items.title: 'A dream' - Redknapp's The Jukebox Man wins King George
items.summary: Harry Redknapp's The Jukebox Man rallies at the last to clinch a thrilling victory in the King George VI Chase at Kempton Park.

items.title: Box Office Studio Report Card: Warnersâ€™ Bets Pay Off, Disney Scores but Marvel Struggles, Tom Cruise Canâ€™t Save Paramount
items.summary: Family films flourished, video game adaptations triumphed, and superheroes flew too close to the sun. Welcome to 2025 at the multiplexes! It was a roller-coaster year at cinemas and for the studios tasked with keeping their screens filled. Warner Bros. enjoyed an epic run at the box office, fieldinâ€¦

items.title: AMD's dual-cache Ryzen 9 9950X3D2 appears in first benchmark leaks â€” gaming-focused CPU features 192MB of L3 cache stacked across both CCDs
items.summary: AMD is preparing a new flagship gaming chip, the Ryzen 9 9950X3D2, which is said to have 192MB of L3 cache thanks to its dual-cache design that will add 3D V-Cache across both CCDs. The CPU originally leaked months ago, but it has finally appeared on benchmarking databases PassMark and Geekbench, wâ€¦

items.title: The best Boxing Day tech deals at Amazon UK, Argos, Currys, Very, and more â€” huge price drops on gaming PCs, 3D printers, laptops, and peripherals
items.summary: Christmas might be over with, but it's time to secure yourself a Boxing Day tech deal. We've put together a list of the best discounts from retailers including Amazon, Currys, Argos, Very, and more.

items.title: Nvidia reportedly backs away from its effort to make its own public cloud, team reorg eases friction with customers â€” chipmaker shifts unit's focus to internal R&D
items.summary: Nvidia has reorganized its cloud computing group, further scaling back its ambitions to operate a public cloud service that would directly compete with Amazon Web Services.

items.title: Man City players 'incredibly disciplined' - Guardiola
items.summary: Pep Guardiola says his players will have remained "incredibly disciplined" during the Christmas break to meet the standards Manchester City have set.

items.title: Romeo Coolio wins Novice Chase at Leopardstown
items.summary: Romeo Coolio produces a strong finish to win the Grade One Novice Chase on the opening day of the Christmas Festival at Leopardstown.

This actress, still resplendent, emerges onstage and receives a round of applause, a bit of homage from an audience that knew her years before, and is waiting to see what she can do now â€” how time haâ€¦

items.title: LG teases a new chore-completing home robot
items.summary: LG is getting ready to take the wraps off a new robot it claims is capable of performing a "wide range" of household chores. The robot, called LG CLOiD, will make its debut at CES next month, featuring two articulated arms and five individually actuated fingers on each hand. Though we only have a dâ€¦

items.title: Shrug off the RAM price crisis with this $180 off ASRock X870 Taichi bundle â€” 32GB V-Color DDR5-6000 RAM and Cooler Master 212 CPU cooler included
items.summary: Buy this combo deal and get a flagship-class X870E Taichi motherboard, 32GB of V-Color XFinity+ DDR5-6000 RAM, and a free CPU heatsink for $529.99.

items.title: Honor Win and Win RT go official with 10,000mAh battery, active cooling fan
items.summary: The Honor Win and Win RT have been announced in China. The gaming-focused phones come with the latest flagship Snapdragon chipsets, an active cooling fan, up to 185Hz refresh rate, and massive 10,000mAh batteries. The Honor Win is equipped with the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 SoC, which is coupled witâ€¦

items.title: Jota's sons to join mascots for Liverpool v Wolves
items.summary: Diogo Jota's sons will accompany the matchday mascots as the Portuguese's two former sides - Liverpool and Wolves - meet for the first time since his death.

items.title: Realme 16 Pro announced
items.summary: The Realme 16 Pro series will debut in India on January 6. items.summary: In what could only be described as an extremely timely Christmas miracle, a Redditor has received two full boxes of expensive, flagship SSDs worth $5,100, even though they paid for just two. A tale of Amazon's packaging error turned into relief amidst the ongoing component crisis.

items.title: Saudi Pro League clubs target Joelinton  - Friday's gossip
items.summary: Newcastle United's Joelinton is a target for Saudi Pro League clubs, Oscar Bobb could leave Manchester City if they sign Antoine Semenyo, Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner is not intending to sign a new deal with the club, plus more.

items.title: 'Unfair' MCG pitch has 'done too much' - Vaughan

items.summary: SPOILER ALERT: This story contains spoilers from Season 5, Volume 2 of â€œStranger Things, now streaming on Netflix. After four-and-a-half seasons of questions prompted by â€œStranger Things,â€ in Volume 2 of the showâ€™s fifth and final season, creators Matt and Ross Duffer offered answers aplenty, whileâ€¦

items.title: Stokes takes great catch to remove Starc but did Carse bowl no-ball?
items.summary: Brydon Carse takes the wicket of Mitchell Starc after replays showed the England bowler narrowly avoided his foot being over the line, as Australia fall to 152-8 on day one of the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne.

items.title: Carse punishes Green hesitation with direct hit
items.summary: Cameron Green is made to rue his hesitation between the wickets as the Australian batter is run out by Brydon Carse at the non-striker's end for 17, leaving Australia 143-7 on day one of the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne.

items.title: 'That's unbelievable' - Carey fall into England's trap
items.summary: Ben Stokes takes the wicket of Alex Carey as his ball towards the leg side is played by the Australian batter straight into the hands of Zak Crawley at leg slip as Australia fall to 91-6 on day one of the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne.

items.title: 'Absolutely cleans him up!' - Tongue bowls Smith
items.summary: Josh Tongue takes his third wicket of the innings, dismissing Steve Smith for nine to leave Australia 51-4 on day one of the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne.

items.title: Ben Folds Does Holiday Music Right, Offering Fans a Very Ho-Ho-Holistic Christmas: Concert Review
items.summary: Christmas albums still have a bit of a stigma among fans of higher-cred artists. It can be difficult, first, to overcome the expectation that theyâ€™re either cash grabs or sops to sentimentality, and secondly, to come up with an original take on seasonal music, even with the best intentions. Should â€¦

items.title: Samsung Galaxy Watch4's One UI 8 Watch update rollout expands to more countries
items.summary: Samsung released the One UI 8 Watch update for the Galaxy Watch4 about a couple of weeks ago, but only in South Korea. Well, the good news is that Samsung has expanded the One UI 8 Watch update rollout to two more countries - India and the US. The One UI 8 Watch update is currently rolling out onlyâ€¦

items.title: Head drags on as Atkinson takes early wicket
items.summary: Gus Atkinson dismisses Travis Head for 12 as the ball is played onto the stumps, to leave Australia 27-1 on day one of the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne.

items.title: Snoop Dogg, Lainey Wilson, Huntr/x and Andrea Bocelli Deliver Christmas-Themed Halftime Show for Netflixâ€™s NFL Lions-Vikings Telecast

Snoop Dogg, Lainey Wilson and Huntr/x of â€œKpâ€¦

items.title: Newcastle stadium plans in limbo - Howe
items.summary: Eddie Howe says Newcastle's stadium and training ground plans are "in limbo" and there is a "99.9% chance" he will not be in charge when they are realised.
